lines.text:
[on seeing a slot machine]
Well, by huckleberry, if'n it dont' look like one of them new-fangled, er, tele-o-phones.
The moral of the story is, don't try to take no 14 karats from no rabbit.
You realize that this is not going to go unchallenged.
I got a full house. What you got, sucker?
Gee, does that beat me? All I got is two pair. A pair of ones, and another pair of ones.
[Puts down four aces; Canasta quivers his lips in despair]
Hey, do you mean I win again?

[Pulls a gun on Bugs]
Yeah, you win. But now we're gonna play another little game.
Another game? Hey, that's great. What do you do, spin this little gadget?
[Bugs spins the cylinder on the gun, and money pours out the barrel; Canasta tries it, the gun goes off on his face]
Now, then, the idea in draw poker is for you to try to get a bigger hand than I got.
[while Canasta is talking, Bugs takes off a glove, inflates it, and puts it back on]
So I deal five cards to the each of us, and we choose the best ones, and we draw some more cards, and whoever has the biggest hand wins. You win, see?
